THE PROPOSED PROJECT 
 
1.  Increasing  financial and  non-financial  solutions  targeting  gender  equality  can boost 
economic growth, bolster well-being to all stakeholders, and create compelling opportunities for 
investment1. Evidence from recent research suggests that promoting a business culture that 
invests in  women beyond social  responsibility  standards  by incorporating  a gender lens  in 
business results in a double benefit through both improving the lives of women and girls and 
generating higher economic returns.2 
 
2.  The Asian Development Bank’s (ADB) Private Sector Operations Department (PSOD) 
works to  benefit  ADB’s private  sector  clients  while  driving  gender  equality  and  women’s 
empowerment in Asia and the Pacific in alignment with ADB Operational Plan for Priority 2: 
Accelerating Progress in Gender Equality, 2019–20243. 
3.  In  January  2020,  ADB  approved  the  establishment  of  ADB  Ventures  Financing 
Partnership Facility (ADB Ventures), which supports and invests in early-stage companies with 
technology-enabled solutions that contribute to achieving the Sustainable Development Goals, 
referred to as “Impact Technologies,” and notably contribute to climate change mitigation and 
gender equality. ADB Venture currently includes the ADB Ventures investment fund 1 (fund 1) 
and the ADB Ventures technical assistance. 
4.  The  proposed  Technical  Assistance  (TA)  Subproject  for  ADB  Ventures  Gender 
Mainstreaming (hereafter the TA Subproject) is designed to deliver quality capacity to design and 
implement gender measures across ADB Ventures operations.  
 
I.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SUBPROJECT 
 
A.  Overall Progress of the Technical Assistance Cluster 
 
5.  This TA Subproject follows the recent approval of the TA for Gender Mainstreaming and 
Gender Initiatives in Nonsovereign Operations Cluster report (TA Cluster), which preliminary 
comprises of five subprojects: (i) support private sector projects categorized Effective Gender 
Mainstreaming or Gender Equity Theme under ADB categorization system in the implementation 
of their gender action plans; (ii) increase women’s access to finance in the Pacific for women 
businesses through the WAVES Program; (iii) enhance gender mainstreaming in climate finance 
projects under the Australian Climate Financing Partnership; (iv) develop knowledge and tools to 
promote gender-lens financing by financial institutions; and (v) enhance gender mainstreaming in 
venture capital financing operations.  The TA Cluster specifies that the subprojects  are not 
mutually dependent  and may be presented  and  approved in any order.  Not all  these five 
subprojects may materialize and/or additional subprojects may be developed over the course of 
the TA Cluster.  
 
 
 
1 Christie D. Gender Lens Investing: Impact Opportunities Through Gender Equity. September 2018.  
2 See research such as: Ostry J.D. et al. Economic Gains from Gender Inclusion: New Mechanisms, New Evidence. 
October 2018. International Monetary Fund (SDN/18/06) 
3 Asian Development Bank. September 2019. Strategy 2030 Operational Plan for Priority 2: Accelerating Progress in 
Gender Equality, 2019-2024. Manila.

2 
 
B.  Subproject Scope 
 
6.  The TA Subproject aims to provide support to the ADB Ventures Team, and its clients, to 
ensure  high quality gender mainstreaming in new funds, investment projects and technical 
assistance grants when applicable. The focus of the TA Subproject is to conduct project reviews 
and gender analysis, define gender action plans in the processing and administration of projects, 
and design guidelines for gender mainstreaming in ADB Venture projects. 
 
C.  Subproject Outputs and Activities 
 
Output 1:  Increased  capacity  of ADB Ventures to  deliver transformational,  industry-
specific gender measures 
 
7.  The TA will serve to support ADB Ventures to better integrate gender elements into the 
project identification and project design.  
 
8.  Expected activities under Output 1 may include: 
•  Reviews and contributions in project preparation documents and during due diligence 
to strengthen the transactions’ gender value proposition; 
•  Monitoring of the implementation of gender action plans for ADB Ventures projects, to 
improve on effective understanding and reporting on the gender measures; 
•  Production of guidelines  on gender mainstreaming in targeted industries  to better 
inform the gender design. 
 
Output 2: Generation of knowledge 
 
9.  The TA Subproject will seek to increase ADB Ventures’ stakeholders understanding of 
gender-lens  or  gender-smart  investing  and  how  gender  mainstreaming  applies  to  their 
businesses. 
 
10.  Expected activities under Output 2 may include: 
•  Production of case studies and good business practices in targeted industries. 
 
D.  Subproject Cost and Financing 
 
11.  The TA Subproject is estimated to cost USD 75,000, which will be financed on a grant-
basis by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-others)4. The key expenditure are 
individual consultant fees, as listed in Appendix 1.  
 
E.  Subproject Implementation Arrangements 
 
12.  The TA Subproject will run for an initial period of two years from March 2021 to February 
2023. ADB’s PSOD gender team, which is part of the Private Sector Transaction Support division, 
will administer the TA and will recruit and manage the individual consultant. Implementation of 
the TA activities will be conducted in consultation with ADB Ventures Team. The TA resources 
will be disbursed  following ADB's Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2020, as 
amended from time to time)
 
4 Subproject 3 funding will be transferred from TA 9948-REG: ADB Ventures Technical Assistance, for which a minor 
change in TA scope and implementation arrangements has been approved to cancel TASF funds of USD 75,000 
from TA 9948 and transfer the amount to the C-TRTA  for Gender Mainstreaming and Gender Initiatives in 
Nonsovereign Operations – approval Memo is attached in Appendix 2.

3 
 
 
 
13.  The TA Subproject will operate in parallel to ADB Ventures transactions and will provide 
gender expertise in ADB Ventures’ investment activities.
